body.head: Richard Specht (born Vienna, Dec 7, 1870; died Vienna, March 18, 1932)

div.p: Richard Specht (born Vienna, Dec 7, 1870; died Vienna, March 18, 1932), Austrian writer about music and music critic.

Specht studied piano with Ignaz Brüll and composition with Zemlinsky and Schreker. In 1909, he founded the journal Der Merker, the chief editor of which he remained until 1919; he was music critic of the Viennese daily Die Zeit 1904-08, wrote for Die Musik 1908-15, and for the Illustrirte Wiener Extrablatt 1912-20. He wrote biographies of several composers, and many introductions to operas and orchestral works.
No correspondence between Specht and Schenker is known to survive.
